test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone1args-1
test-case.description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(lower bound)

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone1args-2
test-case.description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(mid range)

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone1args-3
test-case.description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(upper bound)

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-1
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as per example 1 (for this function) of the F&O specs.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-9
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a subtraction expression, whicg results on a negative number. Uses two adjust-dateTime-to-timezone functions.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-10
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of an subtraction expression.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-11
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as an argument to a string function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-12
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates string value The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as an argument to a boolean function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-13
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The string value of "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as an argument to the "fn:not" function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-14
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The string value "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a boolean (or) expression and the fn:true function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-15
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The string value "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a boolean (or) expression and the fn:false function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-16
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates string value The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a boolean (and) expression and the fn:true function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-17
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The string value of "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a boolean (and) expression and the fn:false function.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-18
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a subtraction expression, whicg results on a negative number. Uses one adjust-dateTime-to-timezone function and one xs:dateTime constructor.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-19
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function where an xs:dateTime value is subtracted.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-20
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function as part of a comparisson expression (ge operator).

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-21
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function using the empty sequence as a value to the first argument. Uses "fn:count" to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-22
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function with value of $timezone less than -PT14H. Should raise error.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-23
test-case.description: Test Description: Evaluates The "adjust-dateTime-to-timezone" function with value of $timezone greater than PT14H. Should raise error.

test-case.name: fn-adjust-dateTime-to-timezone-24
test-case.description: First argument is dynamically empty

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `adjust-dateTime-to-timezone()`.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `adjust-dateTime-to-timezone((), (), "WRONG PARAM")`.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(adjust-dateTime-to-timezone(()))`.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(adjust-dateTime-to-timezone((), ()))`.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `adjust-dateTime-to-timezone(()) instance of xs:dateTime?`.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-6
test-case.description: Test that the implicit timezone in the dynamic context is used if $timezone is empty; indirectly also tests context stability.

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-7
test-case.description: Passing a too large xs:dayTimeDuration as timezone to adjust-dateTime-to-timezone().

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-8
test-case.description: Passing a too small xs:dayTimeDuration as timezone to adjust-dateTime-to-timezone().

test-case.name: K-AdjDateTimeToTimezoneFunc-9
test-case.description: Passing a xs:dayTimeDuration as timezone to adjust-dateTime-to-timezone() which isn't an integral number of minutes.
